job_title: Senior Technical Support Analyst in New Haven, CT
pros: Always something new to learn

job_title: Clinician in New Haven, CT
pros: culture, support, benefits, scheduling, well-known and respected
cons: large emphasis on billing, caseloads, and productivity, pay could be more competitive given high demand for therapists currently, although I have been employed less than a year so I cannot speak to the pay raise schedule

job_title: Recruiter in New Haven, CT
pros: The pay is fair for Connecticut. Do not accept a bonus for a lesser salary.
cons: The work load is very heavy and they are unorganized. Leadership does don’t know what they are doing, especially Cheryl.

job_title: Clinician II in New Haven, CT
pros: Hybrid, good environment, and good management
cons: High caseload and limited holidays

job_title: Clinician in New Haven, CT
pros: The salary and HRSA approved to pay for student loans
cons: Numbers are very important. A big caseload that can cause burnout.

job_title: Registered Nurse in New Haven, CT
pros:
Flexible schedule as a Per Diem nurse
Administration is very friendly
cons: Training is disorganized and the organization is a bit scattered

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Haven, CT
pros: I liked the pay there
cons: HR has terrible reputation of not handling situations that they’re supposed to handle, causing hostile work environments.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in New Haven, CT
pros: Lots of clinical experience is gained and great competitive salary
cons: Half hour lunch and the case load is way too high. No therapist over 70 clients

job_title: Patient Account Representative in New Haven, CT
pros: People work as a team and good place to work
cons: No annual increases in pay given

job_title: Patient Registrar in New Haven, CT
pros: Hours and benefits are good
cons: Little room for growth opportunities

job_title: Manager in New Haven, CT
pros: A community benefit to patients who are vulnerable
cons:
Management is self-serving, unprofessional and unethical in their daily practices and treatment of employees.
Management is more concerned with padding own pockets with high salaries, bonuses, car allowances while underpaying employees, increasing work hours with no additional pay, no pay increases or bonuses year over year and increasing their medical benefit costs which are all poorly communicated to the employees.
HR is a joke with no best practices or procedures, no onboarding expectations, annual reviews, no real training or continuing education for employees, high churn rate of over 35% per year, unethical terminations resulting in numerous lawsuits.
No advancement opportunities.

review_title: I'd return to work here, but it has its issues for sure...
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Haven, CT
pros: Independence. Retirement plan option. OK pay. My supervisor was pretty approachable.
cons: Supervisors never want to be wrong/hide their head in the sand when dealing with legit employee issues. Wasteful company time spent in expected meetings. Pressure to meet quota that no one ever meets due to clients not showing up. Very large company

job_title: Clinician in New Haven, CT
pros: It's a foot in the door.
cons: Huge caseloads, unrealistic expectations, high burnout, high turnover. This organization often hires people right out of grad school who have no idea what they're doing and don't know any better other than to accept the job because they offer a decent salary. New hires get very little training and are expected to hit the ground running. Friday always feels too far away and Monday always come too soon. Leaving Hill Health was one of the best career decisions I've made.

job_title: Health Educator in New Haven, CT
pros: Many people in the community worked there for many years.  There was room to grow.  Paid well for non-profit.  I enjoyed working with my co-workers.  Made lots of friends and connections.
cons: New upper management caused too many ripples.  Made adjusting for staff difficult.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Haven, CT
pros: Conveniently located in New Haven.  Patients are great!
cons: Management is disorganized and plays favoritism.  Short on appreciation for the real workers.  Program Managers are top heavy and some of them take advantage of their positions.  Senior Leadership takse a blind eye to what is going on.

review_title: Was not treated as a professional.  This was at SCRC location.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Haven, CT
pros: Convenient location.  On site free parking. Basically on my own to work my pace.  Good week of orientation to start.
cons: Management rude, demeaning, coworkers unprofessional. Terrible pay. No benefits. Not appreciated. No real security. Dangerous neighborhood with no protection from high risk population served.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Hook, South East England, England
pros: Good sense of mission, working with high-need population so work is fulfilling and gratifying, wonderful patients. Competitive compensation and benefits.
cons: Out of touch CEO, numerous senior management departures, inefficient organizational structure. Constant rumors of impending bankruptcy. Potentially nepotistic hiring of underqualified candidates. Patronizing relationship between management and staff. Major IT issues: Lots of EMR system downtime and crashes. Lack of stable email system (we were encouraged to set up Gmail accounts during the weeks that Outlook was down).

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in New Haven, CT
pros: This job is a good place to work, on the job training, you learn new skills practically every day, I would alsol ike to broaden my skills as well, doing different things in nursing..
cons: Shift coverage, the company can use more good dependable nurses..

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in West Haven, CT
pros: Autonomy (nobody really cares what you're up to as long as you put up good numbers),  decent call schedule.
cons: Management culture of bullying on the high and mid levels, poor to non existent opportunities for in house career development/education,  little to no opportunity for staff/provider input to management decisions, intense and demanding patient population with at times defiant and incompetent nursing staff.  It really doesn't get much worse than this in health care.

review_title: Leaving was the best decision of my life!!!

pros: Benefits and some of the people.
cons: Pay, atmosphere, lack of support from management, lazy coworkers, tons of pressure to meet unrealistic and assembly line type goals
